intro: Sebestena repanda, commonly known as the broadleaf sebestena, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its opposite, ovate leaves and small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. Its fruit is a dry capsule that splits open to release tiny seeds. Sebestena repanda is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to dry, sunny environments.
